results.title: A Town on Ukraine’s Edge, Determined to Escape Its Past
results.abstract: Przemysl’s history has been intertwined with war. This time, like much of Poland, it wants to do things differently.
results.byline: By Monika Pronczuk, Jeffrey Gettleman and Erin Schaff

multimedia.caption: Przemysl, Poland, has opened its doors to Ukrainians fleeing the war. Its train station is a major transit point.

results.title: How Russia and Right-Wing Americans Converged on War in Ukraine
results.abstract: Some conservatives have echoed the Kremlin’s misleading claims about the war and vice versa, giving each other’s assertions a sheen of credibility.
results.byline: By Sheera Frenkel and Stuart A. Thompson

multimedia.caption: The Fox News host Tucker Carlson has echoed Russian claims that the invasion of Ukraine was taken in self-defense. He has also criticized Russia’s president, Vladimir V. Putin.

results.title: Trying to Solve a Covid Mystery: Africa’s Low Death Rates
results.abstract: The coronavirus was expected to devastate the continent, but higher-income and better-prepared countries appear to have fared far worse.

results.title: Taliban Renege on Promise to Open Afghan Girls’ Schools
results.abstract: The schools were supposed to reopen this week, and the reversal could threaten aid because international officials had made girls’ education a condition for greater assistance.
results.byline: By Safiullah Padshah and Christina Goldbaum

results.title: Ukraine War Ignites Israeli Debate Over Purpose of a Jewish State
results.abstract: Most Ukrainians seeking refuge in Israel are non-Jews. Some Israelis see a moral imperative to take them in, but others see a threat to the country’s Jewish character.

results.title: Germany Is Ready to Lead Militarily. Its Military is Not.
results.abstract: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine prompted Germany to revolutionize its security doctrine. But the war has also exposed how weak a link the German military is in NATO.

results.title: How Europe Got Hooked on Russian Gas Despite Reagan’s Warnings
results.abstract: A Soviet-era pipeline, opposed by the president but supported by the oil and gas industry, set up the dependency that today helps fund the Russian assault on Ukraine.

results.title: China Finds Flight Recorder From Plane Crash as Rain Hinders Search
results.abstract: Officials have revealed few details about the China Eastern Airlines flight that went down Monday, with the government moving quickly to control the information flow and emphasize the positive.

results.title: Pakistan’s Cricket-Star-Turned-Prime Minister Fights for Survival
results.abstract: Soaring inflation and a rift with the military threaten Imran Khan’s tenure as prime minister. He has dismissed criticism as a foreign conspiracy.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

results.title: Divorce Is Down in China, but So Are Marriages
results.abstract: While officials say a new law has helped save marriages, the bigger challenge in the country’s demographic crisis is that fewer people are getting married in the first place.

results.title: As Russia Stalls in Ukraine, Dissent Brews Over Putin’s Leadership
results.abstract: Military losses have mounted, progress has slowed, and a blame game has begun among some Russian supporters of the war.
results.byline: By Anton Troianovski and Michael Schwirtz

results.abstract: The crash of the Boeing plane, with more than 130 people on board, is China’s worst air disaster in more than a decade.

results.abstract: Aerial dogfights. Top Gun-style duels. Ukraine’s fighter pilots are badly outnumbered but have so far kept Russia from controlling the skies.

results.title: Putin’s climate envoy steps down from his Kremlin post, reportedly over the Ukraine war.
results.abstract: The envoy, Anatoly Chubais, was reported to have become the senior-most Russian government official to quit over the invasion.

results.abstract: The move came after five historians called into question the findings of the book, in which a “cold case” team sought to answer a long-running mystery.

results.abstract: A shipwreck in the Gulf of Mexico is identified and the mystery of its multiracial crew’s fate unraveled.

results.title: Zelensky invokes memories of Fukushima and a chemical attack in his address to Japan’s Parliament.
results.abstract: President Volodymyr Zelensky said that Russia’s invasion could set off a nuclear catastrophe in Chernobyl and warned that Russia could use chemical weapons like the one used in a 1995 attack in Tokyo.

results.title: A cellist plays Bach in the ruined streets of his hometown.
results.abstract: Denys Karachevtsev said on social media that he hoped his performance would bring aid and attention for Kharkiv, Ukraine’s second largest city, which has been heavily bombarded.

results.title: Russia’s Attacks on Civilian Targets Have Obliterated Everyday Life in Ukraine
results.abstract: In the weeks since Russia began its invasion, more than 1,500 civilian buildings, structures and vehicles in Ukraine have been damaged or destroyed.
results.byline: By Keith Collins, Danielle Ivory, Jon Huang, Cierra S. Queen, Lauryn Higgins, Jess Ruderman, Kristine White and Bonnie G. Wong

results.abstract: Russia’s advance falters.

results.title: Here are the latest developments.
Brain Implant Allows Fully Paralyzed Patient to Communicate
results.abstract: Letter by painstaking letter, a man in a completely locked-in state was able to formulate words and sentences using only his thoughts.

results.abstract: Desperate fighting has shifted the front lines but neither side seems to have a decisive upper hand as Ukraine’s suffering deepens.

results.title: Yvan Colonna, Corsican Jailed for French Prefect’s Murder, Dies at 61
results.abstract: A folk hero for Corsica’s nationalist movement, he evaded a long manhunt but was finally arrested in 2003. He died shortly after being brutally attacked in prison.

multimedia.caption: A rally was held for the pro-independence activist Yvan Colonna in the Corsican city of Bastia this month after he was assaulted in prison, where he was serving a life sentence for murder.

results.title: A Kremlin spokesman says Russia could use nuclear weapons if there is ‘an existential threat for our country.’
results.abstract: The spokesman, Dmitri S. Peskov, made the comment after describing Ukraine, the neighboring country Russia invaded a month ago, as having been created by anti-Russian Western powers.

results.title: Biden Plans Sanctions on Russian Lawmakers as He Heads to Europe
results.abstract: A chief goal of the meetings this week is to show that Russia’s invasion of Ukraine will not lead to sniping and disagreement among the United States and its allies.

results.title: Ukraine War and Pandemic Force Nations to Retreat From Globalization
results.abstract: Conflicts among the U.S., Russia and China — and endless Covid-19 outbreaks — strain the interdependent economy and Western ideas of post-Cold War stability.

results.abstract: All three countries are navigating fraught relationships with the Biden administration amid the quickly changing geopolitical landscape precipitated by Russia’s war on Ukraine.
